alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 4:46AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS POSSIBLE SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING ALONG THE NORTHERN BRISTOL BAY COAST INCLUDING NUSHAGAK BAY... Gale force south to southwesterly winds will increase through Saturday evening as a strong storm system moves from the eastern Bering to Bristol Bay. The strong winds will result in elevated water levels with the potential for water pushing up through cracks in the ice and ice pushing up on shore along south and west facing shorelines. The greatest chance for elevated water levels and potential ice shoves is expected to be along the Northern Bristol Bay coast between Togiak and Naknek. Water levels are expected to rise above normal highest tide by early Saturday afternoon with the highest water levels expected Saturday evening before slowly subsiding late Saturday night. residents with interests along the coast should move items well above the normal high tide line.
